questions.text: A 34y G2 presents to the emergency with painful vaginal bleeding since a few hours. She is 32 weeks pregnant. Her last visit was at 28 weeks when her BP was 130/90 mmHg and the last ultrasound was normal; after which she did not visit. On examination, she is pale, the uterus is tense and tender, corresponding to 34 weeks. FHR is 160 bpm. What is the next best step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Induction of labor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Placental abruption is a clinical diagnosis and necessitates immediate delivery, regardless of gestational age, to ensure maternal and fetal safety.

questions.text: A 25-year-old primigravida presented in OBG emergency with 38 weeks of amenorrhea. On examination, cervical dilatation is 6 cm. According to you, which stage of labor is she in?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Active stage

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The active phase of the first stage of labor begins at 5 cm of cervical dilatation, according to modern definitions.

questions.text: A 57-year-old woman has an endometrial thickness of 14 mm on transvaginal scan (TVS). An endometrial biopsy shows complex endometrial hyperplasia with the presence of atypical cells. What is the next best step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Hysterectomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Complex endometrial hyperplasia with atypia in a postmenopausal woman is managed with a hysterectomy due to the significant risk of progression to endometrial cancer.

questions.text: On performing a laparoscopic procedure for an ectopic pregnancy, the following image was seen at the hepatic area. What could have been the possible cause of the ectopic pregnancy?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) PID

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fitz-Hugh-Curtis syndrome, characterized by violin-string adhesions near the liver, is strongly associated with PID, a significant risk factor for ectopic pregnancy.

questions.text: Which is not an indication for a cesarean section?

options.label: D
options.text: Twin pregnancy with 1st twin in breech

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Previous D & C

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A previous D & C is not a routine indication for cesarean section. Indications for cesarean include a previous upper segment cesarean, active genital herpes, and twin pregnancy with the first twin in breech presentation.

questions.text: A 23y woman presents to the antenatal OPD. She gives a history of missing her periods but does not remember the date of her last period. The uterus is not palpable abdominally. A urine pregnancy test is positive. What is the best way to determine the gestational age?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) CRL on USG

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Crown-Rump Length (CRL) on ultrasound is the most accurate method to determine gestational age in the first trimester, with an accuracy of ±3-5 days.

questions.text: Which of the following is increased in a mother carrying a fetus with Down syndrome?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) β hCG

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ β hCG levels are increased in pregnancies with Down syndrome, while PAPP-A and AFP are decreased. Down syndrome screening combines ultrasound markers like nuchal translucency and biochemical markers like β hCG and PAPP-A.

questions.text: Which of the following situations is not managed by using Ventouse for a delivery?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Premature baby

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ventouse (vacuum) is contraindicated in preterm babies due to the risk of intracranial trauma. It is suitable for conditions such as prolonged second stage, maternal exhaustion, and fetal distress under favorable circumstances.

questions.text: Turtle sign is seen in:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Shoulder dystocia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The turtle sign is a hallmark of shoulder dystocia, indicating retraction of the fetal head due to shoulder impaction at the pelvic inlet. This is an obstetric emergency requiring immediate intervention.

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman presented to OPD with complaint of greenish-frothy vaginal discharge for 1 month. Examination revealed finding as shown in image. On saline microscopy, motile organisms are noticed. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Trichomoniasis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Trichomoniasis is characterized by greenish-frothy discharge, a strawberry cervix (colpitis macularis), and motile organisms on saline microscopy.

questions.text: What problem can be encountered with the following kind of pelvis during labor?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Obstructed labor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The android pelvis is heart-shaped and is often associated with obstructed labor due to its narrower pelvic cavity and prominent spines.
  • ➤ android pelvis
  • ➤ obstructed labor

questions.text: The lifespan of the device shown below is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 5 years

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Copper T 375 is a long-acting reversible contraceptive with a lifespan of 5 years .
  • ➤ Copper T 375
  • ➤ 5 years

questions.text: Implantation of the blastocyst as shown by the arrow occurs on which day?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 8 days

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Implantation of the blastocyst begins on Day 5-6, is half completed by Day 8, and is fully completed by Day 11-12.

questions.text: A 30y primigravida presents for her regular antenatal checkup at 32 weeks. On examination, the fundal grip reveals a hard ballotable structure. What is your inference?

options.label: A
options.text: The fetus is in cephalic presentation

options.label: B
options.text: The fetus is in breech presentation

options.label: C
options.text: The fetus is in transverse lie

options.label: D
options.text: The presentation cannot be made out

questions.correct_answer: B. The fetus is in breech presentation
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) The fetus is in breech presentation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A hard ballotable structure felt at the fundus during fundal grip examination strongly suggests the fetus is in a breech presentation .
  • ➤ hard ballotable structure
  • ➤ fundus
  • ➤ breech presentation

questions.text: A 27y woman presents to the prenatal OPD. This is her 4th pregnancy. She had a preterm twin delivery last year at 32 weeks out of which only 1 baby survived. She also gives a history of 2 spontaneous abortions prior to the twin pregnancy. What is her parity index?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) G4P1A2

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For calculating the parity index, twin deliveries count as one pregnancy carried to viability. The correct parity index for this patient is G4P1A2L1 .
  • ➤ one pregnancy
  • ➤ G4P1A2L1

questions.text: Following delivery of a twin pregnancy which was unbooked, the placenta is examined and is as shown. What is the likely time of splitting of the embryo?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) After the 8th day

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Monochorionic monoamniotic twins result from embryo splitting after the 8th day of fertilization, leading to both twins sharing the same chorion and amniotic sac.
  • ➤ Monochorionic monoamniotic twins
  • ➤ after the 8th day

questions.text: A 27y patient at 37 weeks gestation presents with a 2-day history of fever of 101° F, loss of fluid from the vagina and diffuse abdominal tenderness. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Chorioamnionitis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Chorioamnionitis is an infection of the placenta and fetal membranes commonly associated with pre-labor rupture of membranes (PROM) , fever, and abdominal tenderness. Immediate management includes broad-spectrum antibiotics and immediate delivery to prevent progression to septicemia and neonatal sepsis.
  • ➤ Chorioamnionitis
  • ➤ pre-labor rupture of membranes (PROM)
  • ➤ broad-spectrum antibiotics
  • ➤ immediate delivery

questions.text: Which of the following medical therapies has been associated with a modest decrease in the incidence of pre-eclampsia in women at increased risk?

options.label: C
options.text: Both aspirin and Low molecular weight heparin

questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Aspirin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Low-dose aspirin (75–150 mg daily) , started before 16 weeks of gestation , has been proven to reduce the incidence of early-onset pre-eclampsia in women at increased risk.
  • ➤ Low-dose aspirin (75–150 mg daily)
  • ➤ 16 weeks of gestation
  • ➤ early-onset pre-eclampsia

questions.text: A 34y P3 begins having heavy bleeding following a vaginal delivery. You giver her carboprost tromethaprine and perform the maneuver the pictured below and shifted to the OT. What is the name of this maneuver?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Bimanual uterine compression

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bimanual uterine compression is an essential first-line intervention for managing atonic postpartum hemorrhage (PPH) . It temporarily controls bleeding while preparing for additional medical or surgical interventions.
  • ➤ Bimanual uterine compression
  • ➤ atonic postpartum hemorrhage (PPH)

questions.text: A 34y woman has PPH. Surgical devascularization is being done. Which vessels are being ligated in this?
questions.correct_answer: B. Uterine, Utero-ovarian and Internal iliac
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Uterine, Utero-ovarian and Internal iliac

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In stepwise surgical devascularization for PPH, the uterine arteries , utero-ovarian anastomotic arteries , and internal iliac arteries (anterior division) are ligated to control bleeding while preserving ovarian function.
  • ➤ stepwise surgical devascularization
  • ➤ uterine arteries
  • ➤ utero-ovarian anastomotic arteries
  • ➤ internal iliac arteries (anterior division)

questions.text: The image shown is of a colposcopy. Identify the yellow line?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Original Squamo-columnar junction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The original squamo-columnar junction is the outermost boundary of the cervical epithelium and is marked by the yellow line in colposcopy images.
  • ➤ original squamo-columnar junction
  • ➤ yellow line

questions.text: More than 100 human papillomavirus (HPV) types have been identified to date. Clinically, HPV types are classified as high risk (HR) or low risk based upon their oncogenic potential. Which two HR HPV types together account for approximately 70 percent of cervical cancers worldwide?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 16 and 18

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HPV 16 and 18 are the two high-risk HPV types responsible for 70% of cervical cancers and are targeted by HPV vaccines.
  • ➤ HPV 16 and 18
  • ➤ 70% of cervical cancers

questions.text: In the postmenopausal woman with uterine bleeding, evaluation of the endometrium may be accomplished by endometrial biopsy, hysteroscopy, or transvaginal sonography. Which of the following sonographic endometrial thickness measurements is commonly used as a threshold to indicate a low risk for endometrial hyperplasia or cancer?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 5mm

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In postmenopausal women with uterine bleeding, an endometrial thickness of ≤5 mm on transvaginal sonography indicates a low risk for endometrial hyperplasia or cancer.
  • ➤ ≤5 mm

questions.text: What is the most common medical complaint of women during menopausal transition?

options.label: D
options.text: Vasomotor symptoms characterized as hot flashes

questions.correct_answer: D. Vasomotor symptoms characterized as hot flashes
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Vasomotor symptoms characterized as hot flashes

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vasomotor symptoms characterized as hot flashes are the most common medical complaint of women during the menopausal transition. These symptoms result from hormonal changes that affect the body's temperature regulation.
  • ➤ Vasomotor symptoms characterized as hot flashes

questions.text: Septate uterus has a significantly higher spontaneous abortion rate and early pregnancy loss rate than bicornuate uterus. What is the primary mechanism thought to be responsible for this extraordinarily high pregnancy wastage?

options.label: C
options.text: Distortion of the uterine serosal contour

options.label: D
options.text: Partial or complete implantation on the largely avascular septum

questions.correct_answer: D. Partial or complete implantation on the largely avascular septum
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Partial or complete implantation on the largely avascular septum

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a septate uterus, partial or complete implantation on the largely avascular septum is the primary mechanism responsible for the significantly higher rates of spontaneous abortion and early pregnancy loss. This avascular tissue fails to support the developing embryo due to insufficient blood supply.
  • ➤ partial or complete implantation on the largely avascular septum

questions.text: A 28-year-old nulligravida presents with primary amenorrhea. She is diagnosed with 45X0 gonadal dysgenesis. During pelvic laparoscopy, what is the expected finding?

options.label: A
options.text: Streak gonads and male internal genitalia

options.label: B
options.text: Streak gonads and female internal genitalia

options.label: C
options.text: Empty pelvis (no gonads or internal genitalia)

options.label: D
options.text: Bilateral abdominal testes and male internal genitalia

questions.correct_answer: B. Streak gonads and female internal genitalia
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Streak gonads and female internal genitalia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In Turner syndrome (45X0 gonadal dysgenesis) , the expected findings during pelvic laparoscopy are streak gonads and female internal genitalia , with a small or hypoplastic uterus due to the lack of estrogen stimulation.
  • ➤ Turner syndrome (45X0 gonadal dysgenesis)
  • ➤ streak gonads and female internal genitalia

questions.text: Women seeking immediate fertility and who suffer from endometriosis would most likely benefit from which of the following treatments?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Laparoscopic ablation of lesions

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For women with endometriosis who seek immediate fertility , laparoscopic ablation of lesions is the most effective treatment. This procedure restores normal pelvic anatomy, improves fertility, and addresses endometriosis-related lesions and adhesions.
  • ➤ endometriosis
  • ➤ immediate fertility
  • ➤ laparoscopic ablation of lesions

questions.text: This is an ultrasound done of a woman who came with 3 months amenorrhea with mild bleeding. The hormone increased in this condition:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) HCG

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The "snowstorm appearance" on ultrasound, combined with elevated HCG levels , is characteristic of a complete molar pregnancy . This condition is associated with abnormally high HCG levels due to trophoblastic overgrowth.
  • ➤ "snowstorm appearance"
  • ➤ HCG levels
  • ➤ complete molar pregnancy

questions.text: Which is not used as an emergency contraceptive?

options.label: C
options.text: Combined OCPs 2 tablets; repeated after 12 h

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) LNG 0.75mg 2 tablets in 24h

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ LNG 0.75 mg taken as two tablets in 24 hours is no longer used as an emergency contraceptive. Instead, a single-dose LNG 1.5 mg tablet or Ulipristal acetate 30 mg is recommended for emergency contraception.
  • ➤ LNG 0.75 mg taken as two tablets in 24 hours is no longer used as an emergency contraceptive.
  • ➤ LNG 1.5 mg tablet
  • ➤ Ulipristal acetate 30 mg

questions.text: A 23 y P2L2 comes to the OPD. She says that she missed her period by 10 days and is now complaining of spotting. There is also mild abdominal pain. On examination the uterus is 6 weeks size and the os is closed. Which is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Threatened abortion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Threatened abortion is diagnosed when a pregnant woman presents with vaginal spotting and/or mild pain , a closed cervical os , and a uterus that corresponds to the period of gestation. This condition suggests the pregnancy is at risk but has not yet resulted in loss.
  • ➤ Threatened abortion
  • ➤ vaginal spotting and/or mild pain
  • ➤ closed cervical os

questions.text: A 26y old gives a history of two 1st trimester abortions following delivery of a preterm baby at 30 weeks due to severe preeclampsia. She is anxious and wants to be evaluated preconceptionally. Which of the following investigation will you advise?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Lupus anticoagulant

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a patient with recurrent pregnancy loss and a history of severe preeclampsia, investigate for antiphospholipid antibody syndrome (APLA) using laboratory criteria like lupus anticoagulant testing.

questions.text: Which is incorrect regarding Hormone Replacement Therapy in menopause?

options.label: A
options.text: It is effective for vasomotor symptoms during perimenopausal period

options.label: B
options.text: It should be given for young women with premature menopause

options.label: C
options.text: It is useful for primary prevention of heart disease

options.label: D
options.text: Cyclical HRT is preferred over continuous HRT in perimenopausal women

questions.correct_answer: C. It is useful for primary prevention of heart disease
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) It is useful for primary prevention of heart disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HRT is not used for the primary prevention of heart disease due to the unfavorable risk-benefit ratio, despite incidental findings of reduced incidence in certain observational studies. The primary role of HRT is to alleviate vasomotor symptoms and manage complications of estrogen deficiency.

questions.text: A 22-year G2P1 with a history of a previous term still birth at term is now 37 weeks. She complains of decreased fetal movements of 2 days. A Biophysical profile is ordered. All are components of the Biophysical profile except?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Umbilical Artery Doppler

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The biophysical profile consists of NST, amniotic fluid measurement, fetal movements, fetal breathing, and fetal tone. Umbilical artery Doppler is not a component of the BPP but is a separate test used for assessing placental function.

questions.text: A 23y woman is taking Oral Contraceptive Pills regularly since the past 2 years. She presents to the family planning OPD on Day 8 of her menstrual cycle with the complaint that she has missed taking 2 pills on Day 7 and 8. What will you advise her?

options.label: A
options.text: Take the last missed pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining packet

options.label: B
options.text: Take the missed pill as soon as possible and offer her emergency contraception also

options.label: C
options.text: Take the missed pill as soon as possible and use additional contraception for 7 days

options.label: D
options.text: Take the missed pill as soon as possible, use emergency contraception and discard the remaining packet

questions.correct_answer: A. Take the last missed pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining packet
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Take the last missed pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining packet

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When a woman misses one or two contraceptive pills, advise her to take the last missed pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining pills as scheduled. There is no need for emergency contraception or additional contraceptive measures.

questions.text: All are true regarding postpartum contraception except:

options.label: A
options.text: With full or near full breast-feeding, 70% of women remain amenorrheic through 6 months

options.label: B
options.text: With partial feeding or no breast feeding, a contraceptive method should begin during the 3rd postpartum week

options.label: C
options.text: The progestin only minipill does not affect lactation

options.label: D
options.text: The vaginal ring can be used effectively in breast feeding mothers as absorption of estrogen is minimal and does not affect lactation.

questions.correct_answer: D. The vaginal ring can be used effectively in breast feeding mothers as absorption of estrogen is minimal and does not affect lactation.
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) The vaginal ring can be used effectively in breast feeding mothers as absorption of estrogen is minimal and does not affect lactation.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Combined hormonal contraceptives (e.g., vaginal ring, combined oral pills, or patch) are contraindicated in breastfeeding mothers within six months postpartum due to estrogen’s negative impact on lactation. Progestin-only methods are preferred.

questions.text: An intrauterine pregnancy of approximately 10 weeks gestation is confirmed in a 30-year-old gravida 5, para 4 woman with an IUD in place. The patient expresses a strong desire for the pregnancy to be continued. On examination, the uterus is 10 weeks size, and the string of the IUD is noted to be protruding from the cervical os. The most appropriate course of action is:

options.label: A
options.text: Leave the IUD in place without any other treatment

options.label: B
options.text: Leave the IUD in place and start prophylactic antibiotics

options.label: D
options.text: USG to rule out ectopic pregnancy

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Remove the IUD immediately

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ If an intrauterine pregnancy is confirmed in a patient with an IUD and the strings are visible, the IUD should be removed immediately to reduce the risks of miscarriage and other pregnancy complications.

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presents with infertility and is diagnosed with anovulatory cycles. Which of the following medications can be used for ovulation induction in this patient?
questions.correct_answer: C. Both clomiphene citrate and letrozole
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Both clomiphene citrate and letrozole

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Both clomiphene citrate and letrozole are effective first-line medications for ovulation induction in women with anovulatory cycles, with letrozole often preferred in cases of PCOS due to better outcomes and fewer risks.

questions.text: Match the following drugs used in gynecology with their corresponding indications:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) A-1, B-2, C-4, D-3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A-1: Dienogest : Endometriosis B-2: Letrozole : Medical Abortion C-4: Ulipristal Acetate : Emergency Contraception D-3: Tamoxifen : Breast Cancer
  • ➤ A-1: Dienogest : Endometriosis
  • ➤ A-1: Dienogest
  • ➤ B-2: Letrozole : Medical Abortion
  • ➤ B-2: Letrozole
  • ➤ C-4: Ulipristal Acetate : Emergency Contraception
  • ➤ C-4: Ulipristal Acetate
  • ➤ D-3: Tamoxifen : Breast Cancer
  • ➤ D-3: Tamoxifen

questions.text: A 42y woman presents with heavy menstrual bleeding and dysmenorrhoea. Pelvis ultrasound reveals an intramural fibroid measuring 3 cm. The woman desires medical management rather than surgical intervention. Which of the following would be the most appropriate 1st line drug in this woman?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Antifibrinolytic with NSAID

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The first-line treatment for a woman with heavy menstrual bleeding and dysmenorrhea due to a small fibroid is antifibrinolytic agents (e.g., tranexamic acid) combined with NSAIDs to reduce symptoms while avoiding significant side effects.
  • ➤ antifibrinolytic agents (e.g., tranexamic acid) combined with NSAIDs

questions.text: A 33-year woman comes to the OPD with amenorrhea of 6 weeks and mild vaginal bleeding. Her urine pregnancy test is positive. A transvaginal ultrasound is done which shows normal uterus and adnexa. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Pregnancy of undetermined location

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pregnancy of undetermined location is a provisional diagnosis made when a positive pregnancy test is present, but ultrasound does not confirm an intrauterine or ectopic pregnancy. Serial serum beta-hCG measurements are essential for further evaluation.
  • ➤ Pregnancy of undetermined location

questions.text: A 34-year woman presents to the gyn OPD with an ultrasound report of an unruptured tubal ectopic pregnancy. She has no symptoms and is hemodynamically stable. Her βhCG is 600 IU/L. The ultrasound shows a gestational sac measuring 20 mm in the right adnexa with no yolk sac or embryo seen. Which of these is the most appropriate management?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Expectant management

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Expectant management is the preferred approach for stable patients with an early ectopic pregnancy, low βhCG levels (<1000 IU/L), and no significant symptoms. Close monitoring with serial βhCG levels is essential to ensure resolution.

questions.text: Of mullerian defects, which has the lowest associated risk of recurrent miscarriage and is shown here in this three-dimensional sonographic image?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Arcuate uterus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The arcuate uterus has the lowest associated risk of recurrent miscarriage among Müllerian anomalies and is characterized by a single cavity with a broad-based indentation at the fundus.
  • ➤ arcuate uterus

questions.text: Characteristics of the soft, fleshy intrauterine growth, shown here exhibiting a single feeder vessel, include which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: The main diagnostic tool is a Pap smear

options.label: B
options.text: It is a rare cause of abnormal uterine bleeding

options.label: D
options.text: Use of combined oral contraceptive pills appears to be protective

questions.correct_answer: D. Use of combined oral contraceptive pills appears to be protective
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Use of combined oral contraceptive pills appears to be protective

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Endometrial polyps are a common benign cause of abnormal uterine bleeding, often identified by their characteristic single feeder vessel on Doppler ultrasound. Combined oral contraceptive pills can be protective by reducing endometrial proliferation.
  • ➤ single feeder vessel

questions.text: All can be used as distension media during diagnostic hysteroscopy except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Air

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Distension media for hysteroscopy include glycine, normal saline, and carbon dioxide. Air is never used due to the risk of air embolism and its ineffectiveness as a distension medium.
  • ➤ Air is never used

questions.text: A 34y P2L2 presents with secondary amenorrhoea. On evaluation, she does not bleed despite giving Estrogen and Progesterone. A hysteroscopy done shows this. What is the best management option?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Hysteroscopic Adhesiolysis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of secondary amenorrhea due to intrauterine adhesions (Asherman syndrome) , the best management is hysteroscopic adhesiolysis , followed by hormonal therapy to prevent adhesion reformation and promote endometrial recovery.
  • ➤ secondary amenorrhea due to intrauterine adhesions (Asherman syndrome)
  • ➤ hysteroscopic adhesiolysis

questions.text: A 28-year-old G1P1 woman complains of significant dysmenorrhea & dyspareunia. She has regular periods & has no past history of any abdominal surgery or any vaginal infection. Which of the following tests would most likely identify the etiology of the infertility in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Laparoscopy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a patient with dysmenorrhea, dyspareunia, and infertility , the most likely diagnosis is endometriosis , which is best diagnosed with laparoscopy , the gold standard test.
  • ➤ dysmenorrhea, dyspareunia, and infertility
  • ➤ endometriosis
  • ➤ laparoscopy

questions.text: A 32y lady presents to the OPD. She has a Copper T inserted 5 years earlier. She now wants to conceive and has come for removal of the copper T. Which instruments are required for this procedure? Cusco speculum Vulsellum Uterine sound Artery forceps Anterior vaginal wall retractor Allis forceps
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) a, d

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For the removal of a Copper T, the only essential instruments are a Cusco speculum and artery forceps .
  • ➤ Cusco speculum
  • ➤ artery forceps
  • ➤ Note :
  • ➤ Note
  • ➤ Procedure for Removal:
  • ➤ Procedure for Removal:
  • ➤ Position the patient : Ensure the patient is in the lithotomy position. Insert Cusco speculum : Used to visualize the cervix and the threads of the IUD. Identify the threads : Locate the threads of the Copper T extending from the cervical os. Use artery forceps : Grasp the threads with artery forceps and gently pull the IUD out. No additional instruments are required unless the threads are not visible or if complications (e.g., embedded IUD) are present.
  • ➤ Position the patient : Ensure the patient is in the lithotomy position.
  • ➤ Position the patient
  • ➤ Insert Cusco speculum : Used to visualize the cervix and the threads of the IUD.
  • ➤ Insert Cusco speculum
  • ➤ Identify the threads : Locate the threads of the Copper T extending from the cervical os.
  • ➤ Identify the threads
  • ➤ Use artery forceps : Grasp the threads with artery forceps and gently pull the IUD out.
  • ➤ Use artery forceps
  • ➤ No additional instruments are required unless the threads are not visible or if complications (e.g., embedded IUD) are present.
  • ➤ No additional instruments are required
  • ➤ Complicated Cases:
  • ➤ Complicated Cases:
  • ➤ If the threads are not visible , additional instruments like an ultrasound for guidance and uterine sound may be needed to locate the IUD. If the IUD is embedded , removal might require hysteroscopy or laparoscopy.
  • ➤ If the threads are not visible , additional instruments like an ultrasound for guidance and uterine sound may be needed to locate the IUD.
  • ➤ not visible
  • ➤ If the IUD is embedded , removal might require hysteroscopy or laparoscopy.
  • ➤ embedded
  • ➤ Copper T Insertion
  • ➤ Copper T Insertion
  • ➤ Instruments Required for Insertion:
  • ➤ Instruments Required for Insertion:
  • ➤ Sims speculum : Provides a clear view of the cervix. Anterior vaginal wall retractor : Often used with the Sims speculum for better visualization. Vulsellum forceps : Used to hold the anterior lip of the cervix to stabilize it. Uterine sound : Measures the length of the uterine cavity to ensure proper placement of the Copper T. Copper T applicator : The device is preloaded onto the applicator for insertion. Scissors : Used to trim the threads of the Copper T after insertion.
  • ➤ Sims speculum : Provides a clear view of the cervix.
  • ➤ Sims speculum
  • ➤ Anterior vaginal wall retractor : Often used with the Sims speculum for better visualization.
  • ➤ Anterior vaginal wall retractor
  • ➤ Vulsellum forceps : Used to hold the anterior lip of the cervix to stabilize it.
  • ➤ Vulsellum forceps
  • ➤ Uterine sound : Measures the length of the uterine cavity to ensure proper placement of the Copper T.
  • ➤ Uterine sound
  • ➤ Copper T applicator : The device is preloaded onto the applicator for insertion.
  • ➤ Copper T applicator
  • ➤ Scissors : Used to trim the threads of the Copper T after insertion.
  • ➤ Scissors
  • ➤ Steps of Insertion:
  • ➤ Steps of Insertion:
  • ➤ Stabilize the cervix with a vulsellum forceps. Measure the uterine cavity using a uterine sound to ensure the correct placement depth. Load the Copper T onto its applicator and insert it into the uterine cavity following the measured depth. Release the Copper T, ensuring it is correctly positioned in the uterine fundus. Trim the threads, leaving about 2–3 cm visible through the cervical os.
  • ➤ Stabilize the cervix with a vulsellum forceps.
  • ➤ Measure the uterine cavity using a uterine sound to ensure the correct placement depth.
  • ➤ Load the Copper T onto its applicator and insert it into the uterine cavity following the measured depth.
  • ➤ Release the Copper T, ensuring it is correctly positioned in the uterine fundus.
  • ➤ Trim the threads, leaving about 2–3 cm visible through the cervical os.

questions.text: In which surgery would the instrument shown below be used?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Tubal ligation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Babcock's forceps is primarily used in tubal ligation to gently grasp the fallopian tubes, ensuring atraumatic handling during the procedure.
  • ➤ Babcock's forceps
  • ➤ tubal ligation

questions.text: Identify the procedure being done in the image:

options.label: D
options.text: Large loop excision of the transformation zone

questions.correct_answer: D. Large loop excision of the transformation zone
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Large loop excision of the transformation zone

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Large Loop Excision of the Transformation Zone (LLETZ) is a superficial procedure used to treat high-grade cervical lesions (CIN2 or CIN3) and involves excision of the transformation zone using an electrosurgical loop.
  • ➤ Large Loop Excision of the Transformation Zone (LLETZ)

questions.text: All are true regarding post evacuation surveillance of a Hydatiform mole except?

options.label: A
options.text: Incidence of gestational trophoblastic neoplasia is higher following a partial mole.

options.label: B
options.text: Serial measurement of βhCG is done to detect persistent trophoblastic proliferation.

options.label: C
options.text: Initial baseline serum βhCG measurement is taken 48h post evacuation

options.label: D
options.text: βhCG is done weekly till negative then monthly till 6 months

questions.correct_answer: A. Incidence of gestational trophoblastic neoplasia is higher following a partial mole.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Incidence of gestational trophoblastic neoplasia is higher following a partial mole.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The incidence of gestational trophoblastic neoplasia is higher following a complete mole (15-20%) compared to a partial mole (1-5%). Serial βhCG monitoring is critical for detecting persistent or neoplastic disease after evacuation of a hydatidiform mole.
  • ➤ higher following a complete mole (15-20%)

questions.text: Karyotype of a complete mole is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 46XX

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The karyotype of a complete mole is typically 46XX , resulting from the duplication of paternal chromosomes in an empty ovum.
  • ➤ 46XX

questions.text: A 24y primigravida is in labor in the 2nd stage. The resident asks the nurse to keep everything ready for active management of 3rd stage of labor. What drug should the nurse have ready?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Injection Oxytocin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Oxytocin (10 IU IM/IV) is the first-line drug for Active Management of the Third Stage of Labor (AMTSL) due to its effectiveness in preventing postpartum hemorrhage, a life-threatening complication of childbirth.

questions.text: While assisting a cesarean section for placenta previa, the patient starts bleeding. The gynecologist applies the following suture on the uterus and asks the name of it. What is this suture called?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) B-Lynch suture

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The B-Lynch suture is a uterine compression suture applied during cesarean sections to control postpartum hemorrhage due to uterine atony. It involves passing sutures vertically over the uterine body, compressing it effectively to stop bleeding.
  • ➤ B-Lynch suture

questions.text: Which of the following is a not a component of AMTSL?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Early cord clamping

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Early cord clamping is not part of AMTSL. Instead, delayed cord clamping has been incorporated into AMTSL guidelines to improve neonatal outcomes. The key components of AMTSL include uterotonic agents, controlled cord traction, and uterine massage.
  • ➤ Early cord clamping
  • ➤ delayed cord clamping

questions.text: A couple presents in the 1st trimester and ask about Down syndrome screening. They are very concerned as a relative in the family has Down syndrome. What is the ideal time for doing a Quadruple test?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 15-18 weeks

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Quadruple test is a second-trimester screening test for chromosomal abnormalities , ideally performed between 15-18 weeks of gestation , with the highest accuracy during this period.
  • ➤ Quadruple test
  • ➤ second-trimester screening test for chromosomal abnormalities
  • ➤ 15-18 weeks of gestation

questions.text: A 21 y G2P1 with a history of a prior preterm delivery presents at 32 weeks with abdominal pain. How will you confirm she is in preterm labor?
questions.correct_answer: D. Vaginal examination for cervical dilatation
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Vaginal examination for cervical dilatation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The confirmatory test for preterm labor is a vaginal examination to assess cervical changes (dilatation and/or effacement). Predictive tests like cervical length or fetal fibronectin are supportive but not diagnostic.
  • ➤ confirmatory test for preterm labor
  • ➤ vaginal examination to assess cervical changes

questions.text: A 15y old is brough to the OPD by her mother due to concerns that her daughter has not had her menses. She was born at 36 weeks and has had no developmental delay. She is doing well in school and plays on the tennis team. She is healthy and takes no medications. She is not sexually active. She does not consume alcohol or smoke. Her maternal aunt has primary infertility and maternal grandmother had ovarian cancer. Her height is 5’7 and weight is 63kg. There is no acne or hirsutism. Breast dev is Tanner stage 5. There is scanty axillary and pubic hair. On pelvic exam, external genitalia appear normal, and speculum shows a blind vaginal pouch. On ultrasound, uterus and ovaries are absent. What is the likely karyotype?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 46 XY

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Complete Androgen Insensitivity Syndrome (CAIS) is characterized by a 46 XY karyotype with a female phenotype, primary amenorrhea, absence of axillary/pubic hair, and no uterus or ovaries due to androgen receptor insensitivity.
  • ➤ Complete Androgen Insensitivity Syndrome (CAIS)
  • ➤ 46 XY karyotype

questions.text: A 25 y G3P2 presented to the OPD at 29 weeks. Her blood group is B neg and her husband’s blood group is B +. An ICT revealed high titers of 1 in 32 and an MCA shows an increased peak systolic velocity > 1.5 MoM. Which of the following is correct?

options.label: B
options.text: Arrange for cordocentesis and consider Intra uterine transfusion if PCV < 30%

options.label: C
options.text: Give Betamethasone for fetal lung maturity and deliver

questions.correct_answer: B. Arrange for cordocentesis and consider Intra uterine transfusion if PCV < 30%
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Arrange for cordocentesis and consider Intra uterine transfusion if PCV < 30%

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a case of Rh isoimmunization with high ICT titers and MCA PSV > 1.5 MoM, cordocentesis to confirm fetal anemia is the next step. If fetal hematocrit (PCV) is <30%, perform intrauterine transfusion to manage anemia and prolong pregnancy. Delivery should only be considered after 34 weeks or if anemia persists despite transfusion.
  • ➤ cordocentesis to confirm fetal anemia
  • ➤ intrauterine transfusion

questions.text: A newborn was noted to have the following lesion on the scalp. Which drug taken in pregnancy could have caused this?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Methimazole

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Methimazole is associated with cutis aplasia , a scalp defect in newborns, when used during the first trimester of pregnancy. Propylthiouracil (PTU) is the preferred treatment for hyperthyroidism in early pregnancy to avoid teratogenic risks.
  • ➤ Methimazole
  • ➤ cutis aplasia
  • ➤ Propylthiouracil (PTU)

questions.text: Which of the following is not seen on examination of a fetus in transverse lie?

options.label: C
options.text: Lower pole empty on pelvic grip

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Fetal heart in flank

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a fetus with transverse lie , the fetal heart is typically heard in the center of the abdomen , not the flank. Common findings include a flattened uterus (uterine height < POG), grid iron feel, and an empty lower pole on abdominal examination.
  • ➤ transverse lie
  • ➤ center of the abdomen

questions.text: A 25y woman presents at 37 weeks in early labor. After a few hours, the patient complains of leaking per vaginum. The CTG shows a prolonged deceleration and on vaginal examination, the cord is felt in the vagina. The cervix is 8cm dilated. What is the next best step?
questions.correct_answer: B. Lift the presenting part up
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Lift the presenting part up

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of cord prolapse , the immediate action is to relieve pressure on the cord by lifting the presenting part manually and arranging for an emergency cesarean section . Avoid touching or repositioning the cord.
  • ➤ cord prolapse
  • ➤ relieve pressure on the cord
  • ➤ emergency cesarean section

questions.text: If the fetus enters the pelvis with its sagittal suture in the transverse diameter of the pelvis, internal rotation will happen by how many degrees?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 90°

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When the fetus enters the pelvis with its sagittal suture in the transverse diameter (LOT or ROT) , the required internal rotation to align to the Occipito-Anterior position is 90 degrees .
  • ➤ transverse diameter (LOT or ROT)
  • ➤ internal rotation
  • ➤ Occipito-Anterior position
  • ➤ 90 degrees

questions.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding the WHO Labor care guide?

options.label: A
options.text: There is no monitoring of the 2nd stage of labor

options.label: C
options.text: Labor companionship, pain relief posture and fluid intake are all important components.

options.label: D
options.text: It follows evidence based time limits at each cm of cervical dilatation

questions.correct_answer: A. There is no monitoring of the 2nd stage of labor
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) There is no monitoring of the 2nd stage of labor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The WHO Labor Care Guide introduces monitoring in the second stage of labor , evidence-based time limits, and emphasizes a patient-centered approach, including pain relief, posture, and labor companionship.
  • ➤ WHO Labor Care Guide
  • ➤ monitoring in the second stage of labor

questions.text: Following delivery of a 4kg baby to a mother with gestational diabetes, you note that there is a tear involving the perineum and external anal sphincter with intact mucosa. The grade of the tear is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Third degree

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A third-degree perineal tear involves the anal sphincter muscles but spares the anal mucosa.
  • ➤ third-degree perineal tear

questions.text: A 30-year-old primigravida woman presents at 29 weeks gestation with headache and a blood pressure of 160/110 mm Hg. Investigations reveal 2+ proteinuria on dipstick, an elevated SGOT and SGPT and a platelet count of 80,000/mm3? What is the best management?

options.label: C
options.text: Magnesium sulphate therapy and induction of labour

questions.correct_answer: C. Magnesium sulphate therapy and induction of labour
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Magnesium sulphate therapy and induction of labour

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HELLP syndrome, a severe complication of pre-eclampsia, is an indication for immediate delivery irrespective of gestational age. Magnesium sulfate is essential to prevent seizures and stabilize the patient.
  • ➤ immediate delivery

questions.text: A 36y primigravida presents with seizures to the emergency. On examination, she is 36 weeks pregnant with BP 150/100mmHg. She is given loading dose of MGSO4 as per Pritchard's regime but has another seizure. Which of the following should be done next?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Additional magnesium sulphate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of eclampsia with recurrent seizures despite the initial loading dose of magnesium sulfate, administer an additional 2g IV dose of magnesium sulfate before considering alternative anticonvulsants.
  • ➤ administer an additional 2g IV dose of magnesium sulfate

questions.text: A 24-year-old G2P1L1 teacher presents at 38 weeks with fever and rash for 2 days. She gives a history of contact with a child in her class who had chickenpox 10 days earlier. What is the next best step in management?
questions.correct_answer: B. Oral Acyclovir, antipyretics, and hydration
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Oral Acyclovir, antipyretics, and hydration

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a pregnant woman with symptomatic chickenpox near term, the best management includes oral acyclovir , symptomatic care with antipyretics and hydration, and monitoring for complications. Delivery should not be rushed unless obstetrically indicated.
  • ➤ oral acyclovir

questions.text: A 27-year G2P1L1 presents at 33 weeks with itching mainly on the palms of her hands. The itching worsens at night. She gives a similar history in her 1st pregnancy. On examination, her BP is 130/84 mmHg. There is mild icterus and abdominal examination reveals a 32 weeks uterus with fetal heart rate of 140 bpm. Her SGOT is 112 IU/L, SGPT is 124 IU/L and serum bilirubin is 2 mg%. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: C
options.text: Monitor BP and plan delivery at 37 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Weekly LFT and plan delivery at 38 weeks

questions.correct_answer: D. Weekly LFT and plan delivery at 38 weeks
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Weekly LFT and plan delivery at 38 weeks

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy , delivery is planned at 38 weeks , with close monitoring of maternal liver function and fetal well-being. Ursodeoxycholic acid (UDCA) is the mainstay of treatment for symptom control and improved liver function.
  • ➤ intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy
  • ➤ 38 weeks
  • ➤ Ursodeoxycholic acid (UDCA)

questions.text: Under the Anemia Mukt Bharat strategy to reduce the prevalence of anemia, the color of the iron and folic acid tablets given to the adolescent age group are:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Blue

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Under the Anemia Mukt Bharat strategy, blue-colored iron and folic acid tablets are provided to adolescents to combat anemia, while red tablets are given to pregnant and lactating women.
  • ➤ blue-colored iron and folic acid tablets

questions.text: In the POP-Q system of uterine prolapse, how many fixed points are there?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 6

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The POP-Q system uses 6 fixed points and 3 additional measurements to provide an objective, standardized method for quantifying the extent and type of pelvic organ prolapse.
  • ➤ POP-Q system
  • ➤ 6 fixed points
  • ➤ 3 additional measurements

questions.text: An 89-year-old lady with multiple medical co-morbidities presents with pelvic organ prolapse. She has a grade IV prolapse. Which of the following surgical options would be most appropriate for her?

options.label: A
options.text: Vaginal hysterectomy with pelvic floor repair

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Colpocleisis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Colpocleisis is the preferred surgical option for elderly women with significant comorbidities and advanced pelvic organ prolapse, as it is less invasive and associated with lower surgical risks
  • ➤ Colpocleisis

questions.text: A 62-year-old woman complains of constipation and difficulty having bowel movements. She states that she often needs to use her fingers to push her vagina backward to achieve a bowel movement. Her history is otherwise unremarkable. On examination, the lower part of the posterior vaginal wall is seen to prolapse out. The cervix or the bladder does not descend down on bearing. Which of the following is the best treatment for this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Posterior colporrhaphy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Posterior colporrhaphy is the treatment of choice for a rectocele, which presents with constipation and prolapse of the lower posterior vaginal wall.
  • ➤ Posterior colporrhaphy

questions.text: A lady underwent vaginal hysterectomy for Carcinoma cervix. Following the surgery after her urethral catheter was removed, she complained of leaking of urine. Methylene blue dye was instilled in her bladder through her urethra, and she was given oral Phenazopyridine dye. After some time, her pads were checked and it showed yellow staining at the top most pad, while the middle or bottom pads were unstained. She is likely to have:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Ureterovaginal fistula

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The three-swab test is a useful clinical tool to diagnose genitourinary fistulas. Yellow staining on the top swab after phenazopyridine administration confirms urethrovaginal fistula .
  • ➤ three-swab test
  • ➤ urethrovaginal fistula

questions.text: Lochia in correct order during puerperium is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Rubra, serosa, alba

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The correct order of lochia during puerperium is rubra → serosa → alba , progressing from reddish to pinkish-brown to whitish as the uterus heals.
  • ➤ rubra → serosa → alba

questions.text: A 23y woman has just delivered her 2nd baby. She asks the resident for a contraceptive method. The resident suggests an intra-uterine copper containing device. How soon after delivery can this be inserted?
questions.correct_answer: A. Within 10 mins of placental delivery
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Within 10 mins of placental delivery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Postpartum IUCD can be inserted immediately after placental delivery or within 48 hours of delivery . After this period, insertion should be delayed until 6 weeks postpartum to reduce risks.
  • ➤ immediately after placental delivery
  • ➤ 48 hours of delivery

questions.text: The 4th trimester of pregnancy refers to:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) The 1st 12 weeks following delivery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The 4th trimester of pregnancy refers to the first 12 weeks postpartum , emphasizing maternal recovery and infant care as crucial components of holistic postpartum care.
  • ➤ 4th trimester of pregnancy
  • ➤ first 12 weeks postpartum

questions.text: A 28-year-old pregnant woman with a history of hypertension presents to the antenatal clinic for a routine check-up. She is currently 24 weeks pregnant, and her blood pressure is well controlled on a combination of methyldopa and labetalol. She is concerned about the potential risks of these medications to her unborn baby. Which of the following statements about the use of methyldopa and labetalol in pregnancy is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Methyldopa and labetalol are contraindicated in pregnancy due to their teratogenic effects.

options.label: B
options.text: Methyldopa and labetalol are safe choices for the management of hypertension during pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: Methyldopa is safe, but labetalol should be avoided during pregnancy

options.label: D
options.text: Methyldopa and labetalol can cause intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR) and should be used with caution.

questions.correct_answer: B. Methyldopa and labetalol are safe choices for the management of hypertension during pregnancy
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Methyldopa and labetalol are safe choices for the management of hypertension during pregnancy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Methyldopa and labetalol are safe and effective options for managing hypertension in pregnancy, with labetalol often preferred for its superior efficacy and tolerability.
  • ➤ Methyldopa and labetalol

questions.text: A 23y primi presents for induction of labor at 41 weeks. Her cervix is unfavorable with a Bishop score of 4. You proceed with cervical ripening using the agent shown below. This medication belongs to which group of drug:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Prostaglandins

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Misoprostol is a prostaglandin E1 analog used for cervical ripening and induction of labor in cases where the cervix is unfavorable. It is not a tocolytic or NSAID and is not related to oxytocin.
  • ➤ Misoprostol

questions.text: Which of the following is not a test of ovarian reserve?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Day 10 Antral Follicle Count

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Day 2 or 3 AFC is a reliable test of ovarian reserve, not day 10 AFC , as the dominant follicle forms by then, making accurate measurement impossible.
  • ➤ Day 2 or 3 AFC
  • ➤ day 10 AFC

questions.text: Which of the following vaccines is not contraindicated in Pregnancy?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Rabies

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rabies vaccine is not contraindicated in pregnancy and should be administered when indicated, as it is safe and necessary to prevent a fatal disease. Live vaccines, such as measles, rubella, and varicella, are contraindicated during pregnancy.
  • ➤ Rabies vaccine is not contraindicated in pregnancy
  • ➤ Live vaccines, such as measles, rubella, and varicella, are contraindicated during pregnancy.

questions.text: A fetus diagnosed with neural tube defect at 21 weeks. The parents want an MTP at 21 weeks. What opinions are required?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Opinion of 2 doctors

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For MTP at 21 weeks , the opinion of two doctors is required under the 2021 amendment of the MTP Act, specifically for substantial fetal anomalies.
  • ➤ 21 weeks
  • ➤ two doctors

questions.text: Which of the following twin pregnancy is associated with more complications?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) B

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ MCDA twin pregnancies (Image B) are associated with more complications compared to DCDA twin pregnancies (Image A) due to shared placental circulation, leading to risks like TTTS, sIUGR, and TAPS. Chorionicity should always be assessed early in twin pregnancies for proper monitoring.
  • ➤ MCDA twin pregnancies (Image B)
  • ➤ DCDA twin pregnancies (Image A)

questions.text: The following maneuver is performed in which situation?

options.label: A
options.text: To deliver the after-coming head in breech delivery

options.label: B
options.text: To deliver nuchal arms in breech delivery

options.label: C
options.text: To keep the back anterior during breech delivery

options.label: D
options.text: To ensure enough space is there for applying forceps in breech delivery

questions.correct_answer: B. To deliver nuchal arms in breech delivery
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) To deliver nuchal arms in breech delivery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Løvset maneuver is specifically performed to deliver nuchal arms in breech delivery by sequentially rotating the baby to free the arms trapped behind the head.
  • ➤ Løvset maneuver
  • ➤ nuchal arms

questions.text: Which of the following is not a risk factor for epithelial ovarian cancer?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Combined oral contraceptive pills

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Combined oral contraceptive pills are not a risk factor but are protective against epithelial ovarian cancer. Other factors like nulliparity, infertility, and BRCA mutations increase the risk.
  • ➤ Combined oral contraceptive pills
  • ➤ not a risk factor
  • ➤ protective

questions.text: A 45 y P4L4 woman presents to the OPD with post coital bleeding. On examination there is a 2 cm growth seen on the cervix which bleeds on touch. The vagina is normal and the parametrium is free. A biopsy reveals squamous cell carcinoma. What is the best management option for her?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Radical hysterectomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For Stage IB1 cervical cancer , in a young and fit patient, the preferred management is radical hysterectomy with pelvic lymphadenectomy. Radiotherapy or chemoradiation is reserved for advanced stages or inoperable cases.
  • ➤ Stage IB1 cervical cancer
  • ➤ radical hysterectomy with pelvic lymphadenectomy.

questions.text: A 48y woman brings her 15y old daughter to the OPD. Her 65y old mother has been recently diagnosed with cervical cancer and she wants to enquire about the HPV vaccine for her and her daughter. What is the correct statement?

options.label: A
options.text: HPV vaccine for both the woman and her daughter is advised

options.label: B
options.text: HPV vaccine should be given only to her daughter

options.label: C
options.text: HPV vaccine should be given only to the woman

options.label: D
options.text: There is no role of the HPV vaccine

questions.correct_answer: B. HPV vaccine should be given only to her daughter
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) HPV vaccine should be given only to her daughter

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The HPV vaccine is recommended for the 15-year-old daughter to prevent HPV-related cervical cancer and other diseases. For the 48-year-old woman, vaccination is not routinely recommended as the efficacy significantly decreases with age and potential prior exposure to HPV.
  • ➤ HPV vaccine is recommended for the 15-year-old daughter

questions.text: A 30y primi presents at 32 weeks for a routine checkup. On examination, the uterus is 28 weeks. The fetal parts are not easily palpable with the uterus appearing to grip the fetus, and the fetal heart rate is heard very clearly. An ultrasound is ordered. Which of the following will you expect to find on the ultrasound?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) AFI < 5

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Oligohydramnios is associated with an AFI < 5 cm on ultrasound and presents clinically with a small-for-gestational-age uterus, difficulty palpating fetal parts, and a clear fetal heart rate due to reduced fluid interface.
  • ➤ Oligohydramnios
  • ➤ AFI < 5 cm

questions.text: A 34y P2L2 wants a contraceptive. She enquires about Antara. All are true about Antara except:

options.label: A
options.text: Cannot be given in lactating women

options.label: C
options.text: It is given once in 3 months

options.label: D
options.text: There is a delay in return to fertility

questions.correct_answer: A. Cannot be given in lactating women
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Cannot be given in lactating women

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Antara (Depot Medroxyprogesterone Acetate) is a safe and effective contraceptive that can be used in lactating women starting 6 weeks postpartum. Its common side effects include irregular bleeding, and it is administered every 3 months, with a delayed return to fertility after cessation.
  • ➤ can be used in lactating women

questions.text: Identify what procedure is being planned here?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Post-placental intra-uterine device insertion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The procedure shown in the image is post-placental intra-uterine device insertion , utilizing Kelly’s forceps to place the IUD at the uterine fundus immediately after placental delivery.
  • ➤ post-placental intra-uterine device insertion
  • ➤ Kelly’s forceps

questions.text: A 32y woman presents at 14 weeks pregnancy. She has a history of 2 mid trimester abortions. Pre conceptionally she was told that she may need a cervical cerclage to be done. An ultrasound shows the cervix to be 2.3 cm in length. What is the next best step?

options.label: D
options.text: Strict bed rest and repeat a scan after 2 weeks

questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Admit for Shirodkar cerclage

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a patient with a history of mid-trimester abortions and a short cervix at 14 weeks , Shirodkar cerclage is the next best step to prevent preterm birth or pregnancy loss. Trans-abdominal cerclage is reserved for failed prior cerclage or anatomical indications.
  • ➤ history of mid-trimester abortions
  • ➤ short cervix at 14 weeks
  • ➤ Shirodkar cerclage
  • ➤ Trans-abdominal cerclage

questions.text: A 65y woman presents with epithelial ovarian cancer with peritoneal metastases and ascites. What is the management?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Debulking f/b chemotherapy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In epithelial ovarian cancer with peritoneal metastases, primary debulking surgery followed by chemotherapy is the standard of care for patients who are fit for surgery.
  • ➤ primary debulking surgery followed by chemotherapy

questions.text: A patient has just delivered a full-term baby and developed uterine inversion with placenta still attached? What will be the immediate next step?

options.label: A
options.text: Remove placenta and reposition the uterus

options.label: B
options.text: Put uterus inside without removing the placenta

options.label: C
options.text: Shift to OT and insert the uterus back

questions.correct_answer: B. Put uterus inside without removing the placenta
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Put uterus inside without removing the placenta

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of uterine inversion with placenta still attached, the immediate priority is to reposition the uterus manually without removing the placenta to rapidly correct shock and restore uterine
  • ➤ immediate priority is to reposition the uterus manually without removing the placenta

questions.text: A 28-year-old G3P2L2 woman presented to the antenatal OPD at 36 weeks of amenorrhea. Ultrasound shows that the fetus is in a transverse lie. The liquor is adequate, the placenta is normal, and she has no gross anomaly. Both her previous deliveries were normal vaginal deliveries. How will you manage this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) External cephalic version

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a fetus in a transverse lie at 36 weeks with no contraindications, external cephalic version (ECV) is the first-line management to achieve a cephalic presentation and allow for a vaginal delivery.
  • ➤ external cephalic version (ECV)

questions.text: A primigravida is in the 2nd stage of labor for 2 hours. The head is at +3 with caput present and there is FHR is dropping to 90bpm. What is the best way to deliver the head?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Outlet forceps

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the second stage of labor with fetal distress and the fetal head at +3 station, outlet forceps is the fastest and most appropriate method to deliver the baby.
  • ➤ outlet forceps

questions.text: Dose of corticosteroids for lung maturity
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Dexamethasone 6mg 12hrly 4 doses

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The correct regimen for corticosteroids for fetal lung maturity is:
  • ➤ Dexamethasone: 6mg every 12 hours for 4 doses , or Betamethasone: 12mg every 24 hours for 2 doses.
  • ➤ Dexamethasone: 6mg every 12 hours for 4 doses , or
  • ➤ Dexamethasone: 6mg every 12 hours for 4 doses
  • ➤ Betamethasone: 12mg every 24 hours for 2 doses.
  • ➤ Betamethasone: 12mg every 24 hours for 2 doses.

questions.text: A G2 with a previous LSCS underwent cesarean delivery. During surgery there was excessive bleeding, and a hysterectomy had to be done. The image of the uterus is shown. What is the probable diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Placenta accrete syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of massive hemorrhage during cesarean delivery with the placenta still attached, placenta accreta syndrome should be suspected. The definitive treatment is a hysterectomy with the placenta left in place to control bleeding.
  • ➤ placenta accreta syndrome

questions.text: IUCD can be inserted after delivery till?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 48h

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ An IUCD can be safely inserted immediately postpartum or within 48 hours after delivery. If this window is missed, insertion should be deferred until 6 weeks postpartum to minimize complications.
  • ➤ immediately postpartum or within 48 hours after delivery.

questions.text: A23y primi is in labor. The intern on duty informs that the patient is fully dilated and there are decelerations on the CTG. Which decelerations are common in the 2nd stage of labor?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Early

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the second stage of labor , early decelerations due to head compression are the most common and are considered physiological, reflecting the natural descent of the fetal head through the birth canal.
  • ➤ second stage of labor
  • ➤ early decelerations

questions.text: LSCS for breech was done. Intra operatively, this was seen. 2 cervixes were also identified. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Uterine didelphys

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Uterine didelphys is characterized by two completely separate uterine cavities and two cervices. It is associated with complications such as abortions, preterm labor, and malpresentations.
  • ➤ Uterine didelphys

questions.text: Look at the partograph. What is the next best step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Emergency LSCS

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of fetal distress with meconium-stained liquor and an incompletely dilated cervix , emergency LSCS is the next best step to ensure rapid and safe delivery of the baby.
  • ➤ fetal distress with meconium-stained liquor and an incompletely dilated cervix
  • ➤ emergency LSCS is the next best step
